docblock.description: Exception thrown when there is a cURL error
docblock.long-description:
cURL errors include, but are not limited to:

connection errors
timeouts
invalid protocol stuff

docblock.description: URI for the local CouchDB instance
Timeout for requests created from this object

docblock.long-description: Options passed to the constructor will be passed to {@see setOptions()}
Requests should be generated using this method, because then some of the options that were set up when the instance of the CouchDb object were created can be passed along.

tag.name: param
tag.description: URI path (requires leading slash if you want one)

docblock.long-description: Request pools should be generated using this method, because then some of the options that were set up when the instance of the CouchDb object were created can be passed along.

docblock.description: Set the timeout for requests created from this object

docblock.long-description:
All array keys passed will be filtered through a method call that will be generated by capitalizing the first letter of the key and prepending 'set'.

Implements a fluent interface.

docblock.description: Set the timeout for requests created from this object

docblock.long-description:
The database name will be properly encoded for you.

The database name will be properly encoded for you.

http://wiki.apache.org/couchdb/HTTP_database_API#DELETE

tag.name: param
tag.description: Replication POST body as a PHP data structure

tag.name: param
tag.description: A group/key pair for specific stat retrieval

tag.name: throws
tag.description: when $name has an invalid member count

docblock.description: Fetch the body of the message
Fetch the current header key/value pairs
Decodes and returns the body of the message, assuming it is JSON-encoded
docblock.long-description: Accepts optional parameters which are passed directly to json_decode

docblock.description: Return the current HTTP response code
Return the current HTTP response status
Set the raw body of the message
Set the raw body of the message
Set the HTTP version for the message
Encodes the body of the message as JSON and sets as the message body
docblock.long-description: Accepts optional arguments which are passed directly to json_encode. Sets/overwrites the Content-Type header appropriately.

docblock.description: Set multiple values for the Message object
docblock.long-description:
You may use this as a shortcut for setting options, but the method names must conform to

'set' . ucfirst($key)

and the methods can only accept a single value.

docblock.description: Determine whether or not to throw exceptions on error
Create a valid Response object from a raw HTTP message
Get the state of the throwsExceptions option
Set the state of the throwsExceptions option
Convenience function for issuing a query to a couchdb-lucene view index
Timeout for the entire request pool
Add a request to the pool
Clear all requests in the pool
Remove a specific request from the pool
Send (execute) all requests in the pool
Set multiple values for the RequestPool object
docblock.long-description:
You may use this as a shortcut for setting options, but the method names must conform to

'set' . ucfirst($key)

and the methods can only accept a single value.

docblock.description: Add a query string key/value pair
Get the current cURL options (based on the current options)
Get the query data key/value pairs
Set up the cURL handle, perform the request, and return the response
Convenience method for sending a request and decoding the response
docblock.long-description:
This calls the {@see send()} method and then the {@see Message::getJsonDecodedBody()} method, and returns the result.

This function accepts parameters which will be passed directly to {@see Message::getJsonDecodedBody()}. This can be generally used to pass extra arguments to json_decode.

docblock.description: Set the query data key/value pairs
Exception thrown when there is a CouchDB error
docblock.long-description:
CouchDB errors include, but are not limited to:

cannot find a document
unexpected or invalid values in headers
CouchDB crashed

These are not currently well-documented, but they are represented here as a string, and in the CouchDB source code as an erlang atom.

Example: "not_found"

docblock.description: Reason for error as reported by CouchDB
docblock.long-description:
These are not currently well-documented, but they are strings.

Example: "missing"
Decodes the message, which since it comes from CouchDB is assumed to be valid JSON, and then sets up the exception members.
Accepts an array of documents, and the concurrency method you wish to use when attempting to persist them.
Compacts all views in the given view group. See CouchDB documentation for more details.

docblock.description: Fetch results of a list function in a given design document
Fetch results of specific keys against a list function in a given design document
Fetch results of a show function in a given design document against a given document
Fetch results of a view function in a given design document
Fetch results of specific keys against a view function in a given design document
Corresponds to the POST /<db>/_ensure_full_commit API endpoint
Retrieve a single attachment from the database by attachment ID
Retrieve a single document from the database by document ID
POST a raw pre-encoded JSON document to the database
PUT a raw pre-encoded JSON document to the database
Persist a document to the database

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array or object representation of a document

tag.name: param
tag.description: View function to execute on the server
